API Collection# BinaryInteger Implementations

## [Topics](/documentation/Swift/UInt128/BinaryInteger-Implementations#topics)

### [Structures](/documentation/Swift/UInt128/BinaryInteger-Implementations#Structures)

[`struct Words`](/documentation/swift/uint128/words-swift.struct)A type that represents the words of a binary integer.### [Operators](/documentation/Swift/UInt128/BinaryInteger-Implementations#Operators)

[`static func != <Other>(Self, Other) -> Bool`](/documentation/swift/uint128/!=(_:_:)-9eyev)Returns a Boolean value indicating whether the two given values are not equal.[`static func & (Self, Self) -> Self`](/documentation/swift/uint128/&(_:_:))Returns the result of performing a bitwise AND operation on the two given values.[`static func &= (inout UInt128, UInt128)`](/documentation/swift/uint128/&=(_:_:))Stores the result of performing a bitwise AND operation on the two given values in the left-hand-side variable.[`static func == <Other>(Self, Other) -> Bool`](/documentation/swift/uint128/==(_:_:)-4hd8l)Returns a Boolean value indicating whether the two given values are equal.[`static func ^ (Self, Self) -> Self`](/documentation/swift/uint128/_(_:_:)-1bfdp)Returns the result of performing a bitwise XOR operation on the two given values.[`static func < <Other>(Self, Other) -> Bool`](/documentation/swift/uint128/_(_:_:)-3fwln)Returns a Boolean value indicating whether the value of the first argument is less than that of the second argument.[`static func % (UInt128, UInt128) -> UInt128`](/documentation/swift/uint128/_(_:_:)-3t4ck)Returns the remainder of dividing the first value by the second.[`static func > (Self, Self) -> Bool`](/documentation/swift/uint128/_(_:_:)-41n11)[`static func / (UInt128, UInt128) -> UInt128`](/documentation/swift/uint128/_(_:_:)-4hvzy)Returns the quotient of dividing the first value by the second.[`static func > <Other>(Self, Other) -> Bool`](/documentation/swift/uint128/_(_:_:)-8enxk)Returns a Boolean value indicating whether the value of the first argument is greater than that of the second argument.[`static func | (Self, Self) -> Self`](/documentation/swift/uint128/_(_:_:)-k8pw)Returns the result of performing a bitwise OR operation on the two given values.[`static func >= <Other>(Self, Other) -> Bool`](/documentation/swift/uint128/_=(_:_:)-1t601)Returns a Boolean value indicating whether the value of the first argument is greater than or equal to that of the second argument.[`static func >= (Self, Self) -> Bool`](/documentation/swift/uint128/_=(_:_:)-36npw)[`static func <= <Other>(Self, Other) -> Bool`](/documentation/swift/uint128/_=(_:_:)-3wmkz)Returns a Boolean value indicating whether the value of the first argument is less than or equal to that of the second argument.[`static func ^= (inout UInt128, UInt128)`](/documentation/swift/uint128/_=(_:_:)-4j7m1)Stores the result of performing a bitwise XOR operation on the two given values in the left-hand-side variable.[`static func /= (inout UInt128, UInt128)`](/documentation/swift/uint128/_=(_:_:)-6xh2i)Divides the first value by the second and stores the quotient in the left-hand-side variable.[`static func %= (inout UInt128, UInt128)`](/documentation/swift/uint128/_=(_:_:)-75khj)Divides the first value by the second and stores the remainder in the left-hand-side variable.[`static func |= (inout UInt128, UInt128)`](/documentation/swift/uint128/_=(_:_:)-8ko9m)Stores the result of performing a bitwise OR operation on the two given values in the left-hand-side variable.[`static func <= (Self, Self) -> Bool`](/documentation/swift/uint128/_=(_:_:)-906fm)[`static func << <Other>(Self, Other) -> Self`](/documentation/swift/uint128/__(_:_:)-3yi94)Returns the result of shifting a value’s binary representation the specified number of digits to the left.[`static func << <RHS>(Self, RHS) -> Self`](/documentation/swift/uint128/__(_:_:)-70lq0)Returns the result of shifting a value’s binary representation the specified number of digits to the left.[`static func >> <Other>(Self, Other) -> Self`](/documentation/swift/uint128/__(_:_:)-9qcxu)Returns the result of shifting a value’s binary representation the specified number of digits to the right.[`static func >> <RHS>(Self, RHS) -> Self`](/documentation/swift/uint128/__(_:_:)-9tjzy)Returns the result of shifting a value’s binary representation the specified number of digits to the right.[`static func <<= <Other>(inout Self, Other)`](/documentation/swift/uint128/__=(_:_:)-22e6u)Stores the result of shifting a value’s binary representation the specified number of digits to the left in the left-hand-side variable.[`static func >>= <Other>(inout Self, Other)`](/documentation/swift/uint128/__=(_:_:)-6t3cz)Stores the result of shifting a value’s binary representation the specified number of digits to the right in the left-hand-side variable.[`static func ~ (Self) -> Self`](/documentation/swift/uint128/~(_:))Returns the inverse of the bits set in the argument.### [Initializers](/documentation/Swift/UInt128/BinaryInteger-Implementations#Initializers)

[`init()`](/documentation/swift/uint128/init())Creates a new value equal to zero.[`init<T>(T)`](/documentation/swift/uint128/init(_:)-2b08e)Creates an integer from the given floating-point value, rounding toward zero.[`init<T>(T)`](/documentation/swift/uint128/init(_:)-luvl)Creates a new instance from the given integer.[`init<T>(clamping: T)`](/documentation/swift/uint128/init(clamping:))Creates a new instance with the representable value that’s closest to the given integer.[`init<Other>(clamping: Other)`](/documentation/swift/uint128/init(clamping:)-7tt6l)Creates a new instance with the representable value that’s closest to the given integer.[`init?<T>(exactly: T)`](/documentation/swift/uint128/init(exactly:)-13dy3)Creates an integer from the given floating-point value, if it can be represented exactly.[`init<T>(truncatingIfNeeded: T)`](/documentation/swift/uint128/init(truncatingifneeded:))Creates a new instance from the bit pattern of the given instance by sign-extending or truncating to fit this type.[`init<T>(truncatingIfNeeded: T)`](/documentation/swift/uint128/init(truncatingifneeded:)-1xc1t)Creates a new instance from the bit pattern of the given instance by sign-extending or truncating to fit this type.### [Instance Properties](/documentation/Swift/UInt128/BinaryInteger-Implementations#Instance-Properties)

[`var bitWidth: Int`](/documentation/swift/uint128/bitwidth-swift.property)The number of bits in the current binary representation of this value.[`var description: String`](/documentation/swift/uint128/description)A textual representation of this value.[`var trailingZeroBitCount: Int`](/documentation/swift/uint128/trailingzerobitcount)The number of trailing zeros in this value’s binary representation.[`var words: UInt128.Words`](/documentation/swift/uint128/words-swift.property)A collection containing the words of this value’s binary representation, in order from the least significant to most significant.### [Instance Methods](/documentation/Swift/UInt128/BinaryInteger-Implementations#Instance-Methods)

[`func advanced(by: Int) -> Self`](/documentation/swift/uint128/advanced(by:))Returns a value that is offset the specified distance from this value.[`func distance(to: Self) -> Int`](/documentation/swift/uint128/distance(to:))Returns the distance from this value to the given value, expressed as a stride.[`func isMultiple(of: Self) -> Bool`](/documentation/swift/uint128/ismultiple(of:))Returns `true` if this value is a multiple of the given value, and `false` otherwise.[`func quotientAndRemainder(dividingBy: Self) -> (quotient: Self, remainder: Self)`](/documentation/swift/uint128/quotientandremainder(dividingby:))Returns the quotient and remainder of this value divided by the given value.[`func signum() -> Self`](/documentation/swift/uint128/signum())Returns `-1` if this value is negative and `1` if it’s positive; otherwise, `0`.
